Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.
Leather garb worn by bandits. Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth. Attire of the Blackflame Monks. The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.  The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.  Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.
Vest of a nomadic warrior.
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver.

Battered iron armor from a foreign land. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls.

Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.  Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.
Armor made of woven chain.
Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders.
Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest.

Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.
Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.
Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots
Garb with a modest cloth cape attached.
Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.

Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.
Robe worn by depraved perfumers.

Unusually colorful armor. Worn by the knight Jerren.  Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.
Armor of Godfrey the first Elden Lord.
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold.
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth.
Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.  The insignia emblazoned on the front marks out the wearer as the eyes and ears of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.
Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

"A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen. Having slaughtered countless champions during the Shattering, the Fell Omen has become a horror to those who harbor ambitions for the Erdtree, or for Lordship."
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame.

Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard. It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from loft ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted. Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.  The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.

Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame.  But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.
Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage. Both are symbols of glory now past.
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor.
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family.
Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy.
Iron armor of an unknown knight.

Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.  These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.  Altered:
Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.  When this chivalrous dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.
Malformed golden armor.
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.
Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders.  The sons of House Marais are all sickly born.

Tunic worn by Millicent the Rotting

Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the torso.  To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth. Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.  Its thick apron is worn in remembrance Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity.

Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.  An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen and all those seen as impure.
A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
Tattered clothing.
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.  Altered:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer.

Armor depicting the golden lion. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars.
Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. Altered:
Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation.
Thick burgundy robe.
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Armor reinforced with small metal scales.
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.
Witch's robe in the color of snow.
Robe worn by traveling maidens.
Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.  The two known as D are inseparable twins. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.
Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children.

Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.  The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment. Metal armor is heavy, but also study ordering significant damage negation.
Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.  The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.
Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.
Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.
Armor set with countless eyes and ears.
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these pitiful wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield. Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.

Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
Armor used by the Black Knife Assassins.

Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excess of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

Boiled crab meat. Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration, Unlike the "prawn" sold, this truly is crab. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.

A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner. Craftable item. Attaching this cotton to the bottom of one's feet allows for a temporary reduction in fall damage and sound. If you must court danger, at the very least, tread lightly.
Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing. Throw at enemies to inflict damage.
Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard. Throw at enemies to deal damage. This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.
Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to deal magic damage.
A set of five throwing knives bundled together. The thin knives fan out when thrown, dealing damage to the target.
A large knife used for throwing. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss. This heavy throwing weapon is unsuitable for swift attacks, but is able to inflict heavy damage.
Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison-laced tip. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison.
A small stone with a smoldering core. Explodes when thrown at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.

A clump of small stones with smoldering cores. Explodes when thrown together at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels.

Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power. A "faux sorcery" used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Craftable item.

Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Consumes FP. Throw at the ground to create a gravitational shockwave. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers".

Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Throw at enemies, using FP to cause a gravitational explosion. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."

Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Uses FP to emit gravitational shockwave. The desperate ones which scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."
A small stone with a poisoned core. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
A clump of small stones with poison cores. Throw together at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning. Restores HP but also poisons the user. Not recommended for those who prefer to know the origin of their meats.

Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers.  Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those nearby. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.

Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those who host the frenzied flame. Confers madness upon those who have not adopted the flame.

Preparation of dried Rowa fruit.  Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to restore his HP. Humans are unable to digest Rowa fruit, but Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
Preparation of dried Golden Rowa fruit. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to greatly restore his HP Golden Rowa fruit is not unlike honey, and Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
Preparation of dried Rimed Rowa. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to vastly restore his HP. Torrent seems to enjoy the sensation of chewing this frozen, dried seed.

Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution. Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution.  Craftable item. Temporarily boosts item discovery. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.

A lump of animal flesh pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices. Temporarily boosts physical attack. Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they deem heroes.
A lump of beast flesh pickled in egg wash.  Craftable item.  Beasts are highly attracted to its scent.  The rancid scent prevents ingestion by any  ordinary human.
Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts stamina recovery. The nutrients churn through the body, practically boiling out endless power.

Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. Uses FP to temporarily boost poise. The favor allows one to forget any aches and pains. In Death, there is only peace, for in Death, there can be no sensation.

Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity. Uses FP to temporarily raise poise.  It's said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.

Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Pierce a foe, using FP to turn them into a temporary ally. The Empyrean Miquella is loved by many people. Indeed, he has learned very well how to compel such affection.
An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow. Use to gradually recover FP. A prized item that was once used in the Eternal City as an ingredient in intoxicating draughts.

A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice. Cleans off filth and other accumulations on the body while also slightly reducing poison buildup. Filth covering the exterior eventually seeps inside, soiling one's very spirit.

A fetish indicating the guidance of grace. Craftable item. Similar to grace, this fetish draws rays guiding the way, only  without any sense of order. Useful as a last resort for those who have lost their way, or for use  by those who believe that unrefined guidance will lead to truer  encounters.

One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods. Capable of subduing the flame of frenzy if inherited, allowing one to cheat fate and avoid becoming Lord of Frenzied Flame. However, the needle is as yet unfinished and can only be used in the heart of the storm beyond time said to be found in Faram  Azula.
Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of The Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.

Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; true vestiges of gold. Use to gain 50000 runes. Runes of one who was destined to become a Lord, but when the Elden Ring was shattered, all that remained was a distant duty.
Glass shard covered in dirt. Because it sparkles in the light, it might be mistaken for an object of value when seen from afar. It cannot produce light by itself. Essentially worthless.
A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the swamp of Aeonia. According to myth, these butterflies were once the wings of the Goddess of Rot herself.
The thick, coagulated blood of the Albinaurics. Albinaurics are lifeforms made by human hands. Thus, many believe them to live impure lives, untouched by the Erdtree's grace.
A golden-tingerd flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Said to be a funereal flower in an era long past, before the Erdtree grew.
Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins.
Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Found by hunting carivorous beasts. This glimmering blood never rots or decays.
The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life.
Blood-slick roses that bloom in festering blood. Particularly beloved by those who serve the Lord of Blood. Glory to his inevitable reign.
The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty.
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. It is primarily used in perfumes.
A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. This horn began to sprout on a beast that typically bears no horn. Perhaps it's a vestige of the primordial crucible.
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves.
A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Widely found in crystal tunnels.
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Among mosses, it possesses unique medicinal properties.
Eggs of lare crabs which dwell in the shallows. A nutritious foodstuff that warms from within. The flavor is exquisite. Only those of comfort and means know the truth:
A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Widely found in Liurnia Lake.
A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Soaked in arcane dew, it gives off the faint glow of starlight.

A dusky-yellow flower that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items.  Found throughout the Lands Between.  Said to grow from the old fallen leaves of the Erdtree, these flowers serve as the base material for a number of sorcery techniques.
A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Grown in lands afflicted by frenzy, it's used for its pain-relieving properties... Though it's also known to be a dangerous intoxicant.
An Erdleaf flower that has faded into a plate scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Said to be fed by leaves that fell from the Erdtree in days of antiquity.
A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the mountaintops of the Giants. Fertilized by the sparks from the forge at the peak where burns the flame of ruin.
Flight feather of a bird of prey.
Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Found near Ainsel River and other places where giant ants live.
Foot of a four-toed fowl.
Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands.
A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Alas, now that its tail is glintstone, it can no longer beguile potential mates.
Firefly that gives off a golden light.
Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items.

The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede. Material used for crafting items. Kept as a fetish by Golden Order fundamentalists, especially the hunters of Those Who Live in Death. As such, they are found near churches and similar.
Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge.
A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Easily found near the Erdtree.
A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. At the foot of the Erdtree, they retain their color, along with a powerful holy essence.
A purple flower that blooms in graveyards. The hue of ghostflame, it's believed to be useful in calling forth spirits.
A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Such compound stones, found in lands once beset by ancient dragons, are said to be the scales of those very beasts.
Head of a large dragonfly.
Evergreen leaves that give off a faint light.
Rarely-seen dark plumage found
Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Lamentably brittle, it crumbles at the lightest caress.
Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus.
A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Such fragments command a high price due to the magical power locked within. This leaves the living jars unfortunate targets for poachers.
A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices.
A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. It drips with a viscous fluid that behaves much like oil.
A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. A flower signifying faith in the Haligtree.
Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Throughout history, perfumers have prized this extremely fragrant form of miranda pollen, not yet scattered into the air.
A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere.

A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang.  Material used for crafting items.  Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.  These multiple, overlapping fangs grow from a single root. Perhaps they're a vestige of the primordial crucible.
An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. This butterfly appears as if it's just emerged from its cocoon for its entire life.
Flower that grows in toxic terrain.
A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Widely found in cold regions.
A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. This hardy species takes root even when frozen solid.
Resin secreted from the roots of the Greattree.
Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs.
Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky.
An immature bud containing fresh blood. Believed to originate long ago from a strain of buds cultivated with youthful, sacramental blood.
A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. It feeds and strengthens the light as it shines.
Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items.
A slice of thinly carved beast flesh.
Owl eggs that will never hatch. Prized as a symbol of the most sublime slumber.
An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere.
Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.  Material used for crafting items.  Often carried by demi-humans.  Used to make certain items easier to use.
Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature.
A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Though wilted and faded, it still retains holy essence.
Thin, hard beast bones. Commonly used to make disposable weapons.
Thick, solid beast bones.
A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. A skilled hand can repurpose its toxic mold into an effective ward against scarlet rot.
A pale purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting.
A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat.
A smoldering rock containing hot gas.  Material used for crafting items.  Found on Mt. Gelmir.
An ember taken from an eye socket of a corpse. A sign that the deceased suffered from the flame of frenzy. This grape has ripened and burst.
A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City.
A feather from a hawk that lived as one

Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds. Essential vessel for crafting perfume items. The art of perfuming was once jealously guarded in the capital, but after the perfumers were drafted into service during the Shattering, the art became widely practiced throughout the Lands Between.

description: Letter addressed to someone: Confirmed traces of silvery slime in the ruins in front of Stormgate.
Letter addressed to someone: Traces of silvery slime found on Godwyn's Highroad. Just after until the procession with the big coffin passed by.
A written request from Volcano Manor disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted. "Old Knight Istvan" He can be found in Limgrave. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.

A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Bernahl disclosing the names of two Tarnished to be hunted. "Vargram the Raging Wolf" "Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm" Both men can be found in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
